strengths: Exceptionally well-decomposed parallel architecture: 7 agents, 6 skills, 7 commands, and a dashboard are cleanly separated into independent modules with a single data contract (types.ts defines 11 canonical interfaces).

The closed-loop design (audit -> action-items.json -> /bc:fix -> validation-runner -> re-audit -> reconcile ledger) is genuinely novel for a Claude Code plugin. The action item lifecycle with automatic chronic detection after 3 iterations is a real feedback loop.
CLAUDE.md is substantive and operational with 8 Common Mistakes entries, a context-loading lookup table, agent color system, file naming conventions, and milestone-based build strategy.
weaknesses: Zero tests. For a project whose value proposition is verification and feedback loops, having no tests is a critical contradiction.
Format compliance is 20% (8 of 10 files failing prettier). The verification system is not verifying.
The audit pipeline has never been run end-to-end. The gap between specification and proven execution is the primary risk.
critical_issues: Zero test coverage with no test infrastructure configured.
The audit pipeline has never been executed end-to-end.

strengths: The 'before/after' improvement loop is a genuinely valuable product mechanic. The action-item lifecycle with chronic detection prevents stalled improvements.
README storytelling is strong. The opening line immediately communicates the value. Progressive disclosure through architecture diagram, command table, and custom panel YAML example.
Configurable panels create a platform effect. The YAML-based panel system means BoardClaude isn't just a tool but a framework.
weaknesses: Time to first value is too long. No quick-start path exists for 'I just want to see what this does.'
Dashboard requires separate setup. Plugin and dashboard are disconnected -- no auto-launch, no integration.
Zero social proof. No example outputs, no testimonials.

strengths: Multi-agent architecture with heterogeneous model routing (Opus for deep evaluators, Sonnet for structured ones) demonstrates understanding of model capabilities.
Closed-loop audit system creates a compound intelligence loop. Chronic detection after 3 iterations is a form of meta-learning.
CLAUDE.md with 24 cross-referenced context docs demonstrates meaningful use of the million-token context window.
weaknesses: No emergent behavior demonstrated yet. Agents evaluate independently and synthesis merges mechanically.
Agent Teams hasn't been proven to work. The sequential fallback is just running agents one at a time.
The audit pipeline is entirely specification-driven (markdown files). No programmatic logic, no schema validation at runtime.

strengths: TypeScript strict mode with 11 canonical interfaces in types.ts provides a solid data contract.
Good use of modern React patterns: Server Components for layout, client components for interactivity.
CLAUDE.md conventions are developer-friendly: clear file naming patterns, color system, context-loading lookup table.
weaknesses: Zero test coverage with no testing framework configured. No test script in package.json.
Performance concerns: No lazy loading, no dynamic imports, Framer Motion without prefers-reduced-motion.
Format compliance at 20% indicates development workflow issues.

strengths: README.md is outstanding -- 140 lines with clear value prop, quick start, architecture diagram, and custom panel example.
All 7 slash commands documented in commands/*.md with usage, parameters, and JSON schemas.
Dashboard components have ARIA labels. Semantic HTML with proper article/list structure.
weaknesses: CONTRIBUTING.md missing. No issue templates, no code of conduct. Not community-ready.
No working demo or example output. No screenshots, no GIFs, no cached example audit JSON.
No tests. 20% format compliance. Can't verify quality claims.

strengths: Configurable YAML panels democratize evaluation -- accessible beyond expert developers.
Clear one-sentence pitch and strong narrative arc immediately understandable to non-developers.
Plugin architecture with standard interfaces integrates cleanly with Claude Code plugin system.
weaknesses: Zero internationalization -- all UI strings hardcoded in English, no i18n framework, no RTL support.
Missing critical community infrastructure -- no CONTRIBUTING.md, no CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, no issue templates.
No tests, 20% format compliance, early stage production readiness.

top_strengths: Genuinely novel closed-loop architecture: audit -> fix -> validate -> re-audit with action item lifecycle tracking and chronic detection (Boris, Cat, Thariq)
Strong README narrative and configurable YAML panel system that creates a platform effect beyond a single-use tool (Cat, Jason, Ado)
Substantive CLAUDE.md with 24 cross-referenced context docs demonstrating compound learning and meaningful million-token context usage (Boris, Thariq)
top_weaknesses: Zero test coverage with no testing infrastructure -- a critical contradiction for a project built around verification loops (Boris, Lydia, Ado)
Audit pipeline has never been executed end-to-end -- core product is unproven specification (Boris, Thariq, Ado)
20% format compliance despite PostToolUse prettier hook -- the verification system doesn't verify itself (Boris, Lydia, Jason)

agent_a.position: Architecture scores 82 (strong), but verification at 48 drags composite to 69. The design is excellent but unproven.

agent_b.position: Product value is real (user_value 74, narrative 82), but adoption path is too steep (58). Focuses on user-facing gaps.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Both are correct from their lenses. BoardClaude has two distinct gaps: internal verification (Boris) and external adoption (Cat). Resolution requires parallel work on both tracks.

agent_a.position: AI innovation 78, but emergent behavior 55 because agents haven't actually interacted yet. Still theoretical.

agent_b.position: The feedback loop mechanic is genuinely valuable. Configurable panels score 82 on narrative because the framework is real.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Thariq wants emergent AI behavior, Cat values the product mechanic regardless of AI sophistication. Resolution: prove multi-agent execution works while showing example output to users.

agent_a.position: Community impact 72 based on framework potential, but internationalization 25 drags composite to 62.

agent_b.position: Community score 42 because infrastructure is missing entirely. 'Not community-ready.' 30-point gap with Jason.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Jason is forward-looking (framework enables community), Ado is present-focused (current state blocks community). Resolution requires immediate action on Ado's infrastructure checklist before Jason's internationalization work.

action_items.action: Execute the core audit pipeline end-to-end: /bc:audit must produce a valid audit-{timestamp}.json. Prove Agent Teams works with 6 parallel agents and heterogeneous model routing.
action_items.impact: Boris verification 48->60+, Thariq opus_usage 72->82, weighted composite +4-6 points

action_items.action: Add test infrastructure: install Vitest, configure test script, write 5 foundational tests covering schema validation (types.ts helpers), state updates, and action-item lifecycle.
action_items.impact: Boris verification 48->65+, Lydia code_quality 74->82, weighted composite +3-4 points

action_items.action: Create example audit output at .boardclaude/audits/audit-example.json with realistic data. Link from README under 'See Example Output' section.
action_items.impact: Cat adoption_path 58->68, Ado examples 55->75, weighted composite +2-3 points

action_items.action: Run npx prettier --write across entire codebase. Verify PostToolUse hook catches future edits. Add prettier check to CI.
action_items.impact: Format compliance 20%->100%, Boris verification +5, weighted composite +1-2 points

action_items.action: Add CONTRIBUTING.md with setup steps, development workflow, commit conventions, and PR process. Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md and GitHub issue templates.
action_items.impact: Ado community 42->65, Jason community_impact 72->80, weighted composite +1-2 points

action_items.action: Add prefers-reduced-motion support to all Framer Motion animations using useReducedMotion hook.
action_items.impact: Lydia performance 58->65, Ado accessibility 62->70, weighted composite +0.5-1 point

action_items.action: Add runtime schema validation for agent outputs. Catch malformed JSON, retry with schema, log failures.
action_items.impact: Thariq efficiency 74->80, Boris verification +3, weighted composite +1 point

action_items.action: Configure CI/CD: GitHub Actions workflow running typecheck, lint, prettier check, and tests on every push.
action_items.impact: Boris verification +8, architecture 82->88, weighted composite +1 point

action_items.action: Add dashboard auto-launch or link after audit completion. Bridge the plugin/dashboard gap.
Extract hardcoded UI strings into i18n solution (e.g., next-intl). Create en.json locale file.
